commit_message:
Fix mariadb recover seqnum regex

Regex used to find the recover seqnum partition is not
returning the real num id rather a None.
Task fails due seqnum[0] is not iterable.

Change-Id: I1be55b6ebfc17c6d423e638662ec2a9f4b9b49a2
Closes-Bug: #1752128

subject: [WIP]Optimize add_security_group workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-03 09:05:10.000000000', 'files': ['zun/compute/api.py', 'zun/compute/rpcapi.py', 'zun/network/kuryr_network.py', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/compute/manager.py', 'zun/tests/unit/network/test_kuryr_network.py', 'zun/network/neutron.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "[WIP]Optimize add_security_group workflow

Currently, an add_security_group request is processing as following:

 zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py (add_security_group) -> zun/compute/api.py
-> zun/compute/rpcapi.py -> zun/compute/manager.py -> zun/container/docker/driver.py
-> zun/network/kuryr_network.py (add_security_groups_to_ports) -> Neutron API calls
This workflow is sub-optimal because:

* It does an RPC cast that incurs a performance overhead
* It goes through the docker driver which is unnecessary.
because it doesn't need a Docker API call (what it actually does is an API call to
Neutron to update the neutron port).

So optimizing the workflow by reducing the RPC call and Docker driver call. The revise
d workflow might look like the following:

 zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py -> zun/compute/api.py -> Neutron API calls

Change-Id: I69810b2e19bd7dc851b797a66e3548dc3508470b
Closes-Bug:#1737421
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Optimize add_security_group workflow

Currently, an add_security_group request is processing as following:

 zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py (add_security_group) -> zun/compute/api.py
-> zun/compute/rpcapi.py -> zun/compute/manager.py -> zun/container/docker/driver.py
-> zun/network/kuryr_network.py (add_security_groups_to_ports) -> Neutron API calls
This workflow is sub-optimal because:

* It does an RPC cast that incurs a performance overhead
* It goes through the docker driver which is unnecessary.
because it doesn't need a Docker API call (what it actually does is an API call to
Neutron to update the neutron port).

So optimizing the workflow by reducing the RPC call and Docker driver call. The revise
d workflow might look like the following:

 zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py -> zun/compute/api.py -> Neutron API calls

Change-Id: I69810b2e19bd7dc851b797a66e3548dc3508470b
Closes-Bug:#1737421

commit_message:
Add module index for tacker docs

The module index for tacker docs is dropped due to new
PTI for building docs. However, sphinxcontrib.apidoc
now support to build autodoc which replace pbr autodoc.
We can have it again.

Closes-Bug: #1761923
Change-Id: Ie4c98dd6e8b365778cb0d2c377a9600d79cb43d1

subject: Reset multipath.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 09:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/multipathd/templates/multipath.conf.j2'], 'message': "Reset multipath.conf

Current multipath.conf is just for IBM Storwize SVC model, not
generally applicable setting. With this nova-compute may encounter
error when execute 'multipath -l /dev/sda' because sda is defined
as blacklist in conf.

This patch reset the conf file back to default which is same to the
result of 'mpathconf --enable'. Vendor dependent parameters should
be configured separately.

Change-Id: I429e5a6e2a37d9db56d59f88cdbfab12db4813a8
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Reset multipath.conf

Current multipath.conf is just for IBM Storwize SVC model, not
generally applicable setting. With this nova-compute may encounter
error when execute 'multipath -l /dev/sda' because sda is defined
as blacklist in conf.

This patch reset the conf file back to default which is same to the
result of 'mpathconf --enable'. Vendor dependent parameters should
be configured separately.

Change-Id: I429e5a6e2a37d9db56d59f88cdbfab12db4813a8
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-02 19:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of 406 paths in report client

Since it is now [1] mandatory to upgrade placement before nova services,
there is no need for fallback code of the form:

 resp = placement.call(url, version=NEWISH)
 if resp.status_code == 406:
     resp = placement.call(url, version=OLDER)

This change set removes instances of this pattern from the scheduler
report client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/556631

Change-Id: Ic0a8395399030ddaad93132ad0532dfb410596e0
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of 406 paths in report client

Since it is now [1] mandatory to upgrade placement before nova services,
there is no need for fallback code of the form:

 resp = placement.call(url, version=NEWISH)
 if resp.status_code == 406:
     resp = placement.call(url, version=OLDER)

This change set removes instances of this pattern from the scheduler
report client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/556631

Change-Id: Ic0a8395399030ddaad93132ad0532dfb410596e0

* CreateKernelRamdiskTestCase

This patch completes removing using mox
except where 'stubout_session' is used
in nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py.

The 'stubout_session' will be modified

is modified in another patch.

Change-Id: I138657464aecf6712804a87f102a430c242d85a4
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
"}]
commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py (3)

This patch removes using mox in the following test classes.

* GenerateEphemeralTestCase
* StreamDiskTestCase
* VMUtilsSRPath
* CreateKernelRamdiskTestCase

This patch completes removing using mox
except where 'stubout_session' is used
in nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py.

The 'stubout_session' will be modified
at the same time when nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/stubs.by
is modified in another patch.

Change-Id: I138657464aecf6712804a87f102a430c242d85a4
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-11 20:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/repo/debian/debian.pp'], 'message': 'Missing "install" command when using apt-get

Installing openstack-backports-archive-keyring misses the install
command. Also, an apt-get update should be performed before installing
the openstack-backports-archive-keyring package, otherwise it's not
found at all.

Change-Id: I1ec128c1e1d00dd37c348b9c92fb7c6140537c0f
'}]
commit_message:
Missing "install" command when using apt-get

Installing openstack-backports-archive-keyring misses the install
command. Also, an apt-get update should be performed before installing
the openstack-backports-archive-keyring package, otherwise it's not
found at all.

Change-Id: I1ec128c1e1d00dd37c348b9c92fb7c6140537c0f

commit_message:
Fix wrong default openstack repo

The stable/queens branch is using pike repos
by default, if user forgot to supply version they
would get the wrong openstack packages.

Change-Id: I7de9f87a43e40dbe266b8d1acebef17146d29b82

subject: swift-recon-cron: do not get confused by files in /srv/node
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16982, 'name': 'Falk Reimann', 'email': 'falk.reimann@sap.com', 'username': 'falk.reimann'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-19 10:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-recon-cron'], 'message': 'swift-recon-cron: do not get confused by files in /srv/node

swift-recon-cron looks at the drives mounted in directories below
/srv/node, but before this commit, it tried to call listdir() on
everything in this directory, even if it is not a directory.

Change-Id: Id281352f7ab6ecb520eb00f3649873d8c8678608
Signed-off-by: Stefan Majewsky <stefan.majewsky@sap.com>
'}]
commit_message:
swift-recon-cron: do not get confused by files in /srv/node

swift-recon-cron looks at the drives mounted in directories below
/srv/node, but before this commit, it tried to call listdir() on
everything in this directory, even if it is not a directory.

Change-Id: Id281352f7ab6ecb520eb00f3649873d8c8678608
Signed-off-by: Stefan Majewsky <stefan.majewsky@sap.com>

add a getter for connector mapping

Nova needs to check the architecture drivers like
"_connector_mapping_linux". To avoid accessing
private attribute, this adds a new function
"get_connector_mapping"

commit_message:
Add cinder metrics to polling.yaml

As of [1] you can skip using cinder-volume-usage-audit
and instead let the ceilometer-polling agent poll the
cinder API for the data.

Ceilometer itself should know if cinder is available
or not.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/388584/

Change-Id: I1bd6e45060f90fcbc44658f75af45e1b4ebc7acf
(cherry picked from commit 49d53d4c67e2aefde09c246ad6d4884add852670)

subject: Detect when a bundle or a resource needs updating
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-11 05:53:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_bundle/default.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_resource/default.rb'], 'message': 'Detect when a bundle or a resource needs updating

With this change we actually make it so that if we detect that a
resource or a bundle have changed (as compared to the existing already
running resource/bundle) we actually update the cluster with the new
resource. This does happen *only* when the "deep_compare" parameter is
set to true.

Note that when pacemaker updates a resource it will automatically
restart it. This means that if puppet gets reapplied it restart the
resource that changed.

This has been tested in the following environment (applying all the patches in this
series):
A three-node cluster with the following resources:
A) Docker bundle
B) An ocf resource (rabbitmq cloned) with a location rule constraint
C) A VIP resource

The following tests were made
1) Successful deployment of the cluster
2) Confirmed that a rerun of the unchanged puppet manifest triggers no
   restarts (no deep_compare hiera keys are set to true)
3) Set the following three hiera keys and observe that the unchanged
   puppet manifest triggers no restarts/changes:
     pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ocf::deep_compare: true
   Also verify that indeed the 'deep_compare' branch of the code is
   executed
4) Change the IP resource definition (change the netmask), make sure
   'pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare' is set to true, and observe
   that the VIP gets changed and restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Ip[my_ip]/Pcmk_resource[ip-172.16.11.97]/ensure: created
5) Rerun step 4) and observe that no changes took place
6) Change the OCF resource definition (change a rabbitmq parameter),
   make sure 'pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare' is true and
   observe that the rabbitmq-clone resource gets restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Ocf[rabbitmq]/Pcmk_resource[rabbitmq]/ensure: created
7) Rerun 6) and observe that no changes took place
8) Change the bundle definition (lower the replicas number from 3 to 2),
   makre sure 'pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare' is set to
   true, and observe that the bundle gets restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Bundle[test_bundle]/Pcmk_bundle[test_bundle]/ensure: created
9) Rerun 8) and observe that no changes took place

Change-Id: I1730e8e2b3d52690d4e006e588b4819662d6b2a1
'}]
commit_message:
Detect when a bundle or a resource needs updating

With this change we actually make it so that if we detect that a
resource or a bundle have changed (as compared to the existing already
running resource/bundle) we actually update the cluster with the new
resource. This does happen *only* when the "deep_compare" parameter is
set to true.

Note that when pacemaker updates a resource it will automatically
restart it. This means that if puppet gets reapplied it restart the
resource that changed.

This has been tested in the following environment (applying all the patches in this
series):
A three-node cluster with the following resources:
A) Docker bundle
B) An ocf resource (rabbitmq cloned) with a location rule constraint
C) A VIP resource

The following tests were made
1) Successful deployment of the cluster
2) Confirmed that a rerun of the unchanged puppet manifest triggers no
   restarts (no deep_compare hiera keys are set to true)
3) Set the following three hiera keys and observe that the unchanged
   puppet manifest triggers no restarts/changes:
     pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ocf::deep_compare: true
   Also verify that indeed the 'deep_compare' branch of the code is
   executed
4) Change the IP resource definition (change the netmask), make sure
   'pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare' is set to true, and observe
   that the VIP gets changed and restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Ip[my_ip]/Pcmk_resource[ip-172.16.11.97]/ensure: created
5) Rerun step 4) and observe that no changes took place
6) Change the OCF resource definition (change a rabbitmq parameter),
   make sure 'pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare' is true and
   observe that the rabbitmq-clone resource gets restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Ocf[rabbitmq]/Pcmk_resource[rabbitmq]/ensure: created
7) Rerun 6) and observe that no changes took place
8) Change the bundle definition (lower the replicas number from 3 to 2),
   makre sure 'pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare' is set to
   true, and observe that the bundle gets restarted:
   Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Pacemaker::Resource::Bundle[test_bundle]/Pcmk_bundle[test_bundle]/ensure: created
9) Rerun 8) and observe that no changes took place

Change-Id: I1730e8e2b3d52690d4e006e588b4819662d6b2a1

subject: Add a deep_compare option in bundles and resources
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-11 05:53:41.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/resource/lsb.pp', 'manifests/resource/route.pp', 'manifests/resource/ip.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/pcmk_resource.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/update-resources-ae2ef4f9e75e8699.yaml', 'lib/puppet/type/pcmk_bundle.rb', 'manifests/resource/filesystem.pp', 'manifests/resource/systemd.pp', 'manifests/resource/ocf.pp', 'manifests/resource/bundle.pp', 'manifests/resource/remote.pp', 'manifests/resource/service.pp'], 'message': "Add a deep_compare option in bundles and resources

A new 'deep_compare' parameter gets added to resources and bundles
 (defaulting to false). The rationale is the following:

By default pacemaker does not update resources and will keep doing so.
This happens for a number of mostly historical reasons (old non HA-NG
OSP releases had way too many relationships between pacemaker resources
and puppet-triggered restart would cause havoc on the overcloud, also
lack of the code for doing this in puppet-pacemaker was a factor).

When set to true additional code comparison logic will be triggered and
we will actually update pacemaker resources. We do so by modifying an
offline CIB with the manifests resources and then running crm_simulate
on it in order to determine if pacemaker would trigger a restart of the
resource if the CIB was to be pushed for real on to the cluster. We
currently cannot use crm_diff due to a bug where it would trigger too
many false positives.  Using crm_simulate has one small limitation.
Namely, changes in resource operation timeouts normally do not trigger a
resource restart and hence they won't update a resource. Also note that
this is currently only supported for resources and bundles (not
constraints nor stonith resources).

Some thought has been put into whether we should be having the
'deep_compare' parameter a global pacemaker::corosync one or a
per-resource parameter. I chose the latter for the following reasons:
- It might be useful to let the operator decide for which resources the
  deep comparison is enabled (think tripleo upgrades where we want to
  make sure only certain resources are upgraded)
- It makes it much clearer which resources support this deeper
  comparison feature.

Change-Id: I11b5f9097694b88431f21e1e806bc1823386528f
"}]
commit_message:
Add a deep_compare option in bundles and resources

A new 'deep_compare' parameter gets added to resources and bundles
 (defaulting to false). The rationale is the following:

By default pacemaker does not update resources and will keep doing so.
This happens for a number of mostly historical reasons (old non HA-NG
OSP releases had way too many relationships between pacemaker resources
and puppet-triggered restart would cause havoc on the overcloud, also
lack of the code for doing this in puppet-pacemaker was a factor).

When set to true additional code comparison logic will be triggered and
we will actually update pacemaker resources. We do so by modifying an
offline CIB with the manifests resources and then running crm_simulate
on it in order to determine if pacemaker would trigger a restart of the
resource if the CIB was to be pushed for real on to the cluster. We
currently cannot use crm_diff due to a bug where it would trigger too
many false positives.  Using crm_simulate has one small limitation.
Namely, changes in resource operation timeouts normally do not trigger a
resource restart and hence they won't update a resource. Also note that
this is currently only supported for resources and bundles (not
constraints nor stonith resources).

Some thought has been put into whether we should be having the
'deep_compare' parameter a global pacemaker::corosync one or a
per-resource parameter. I chose the latter for the following reasons:
- It might be useful to let the operator decide for which resources the
  deep comparison is enabled (think tripleo upgrades where we want to
  make sure only certain resources are upgraded)
- It makes it much clearer which resources support this deeper
  comparison feature.

Change-Id: I11b5f9097694b88431f21e1e806bc1823386528f

subject: Introduce some new functions in pcmk_common
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-11 05:53:41.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/puppet/provider/cib-orig.xml', 'bindep.txt', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb', 'spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb'], 'message': "Introduce some new functions in pcmk_common

We hereby introduce some new utility functions:
A) pcs_offline() which will be used to run pcs commands without retry
   on a CIB file
B) push_cib_offline() which is used to try and push a cib that was
   manipulated with pcs_offline() back to the live cluster. It will
   try a certain specified amount of times before giving up.
C) pcmk_graph_contain_id?() which takes a resource_name and a graph
   file generated via 'crm_simulate -G<file>' and will return true
   if the resource is going to be restarted by pacemaker and false if
   otherwise. This is used so that we can determine if pacemaker deems
   that a resource has changed or not.
D) pcmk_restart_resource?() which, given a resource_name and a cib will
   return true if pacemaker plans to restart the resource and false if
   it does not. Due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
   we leverage crm_simulate and not crm_diff
E) pcmk_resource_has_changed?() which will delete the resource from an
   offline CIB copy, re-add it and then verify via
   pcmk_restart_resource?() if a restart would take place. The reason we
   need to remove a resource and then re-add it is due to the way pcs
   commands around bundles are limited (you basically can't update a
   bundle with the list of all all the storage-mappings: you have to specify which
   mappings are going to be added and which removed). So the simplest
   way is to just remove the resource and re-add it.

Change-Id: Iba7092b79af3a4dbc2888f35504175d5eb0abcdb
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce some new functions in pcmk_common

We hereby introduce some new utility functions:
A) pcs_offline() which will be used to run pcs commands without retry
   on a CIB file
B) push_cib_offline() which is used to try and push a cib that was
   manipulated with pcs_offline() back to the live cluster. It will
   try a certain specified amount of times before giving up.
C) pcmk_graph_contain_id?() which takes a resource_name and a graph
   file generated via 'crm_simulate -G<file>' and will return true
   if the resource is going to be restarted by pacemaker and false if
   otherwise. This is used so that we can determine if pacemaker deems
   that a resource has changed or not.
D) pcmk_restart_resource?() which, given a resource_name and a cib will
   return true if pacemaker plans to restart the resource and false if
   it does not. Due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
   we leverage crm_simulate and not crm_diff
E) pcmk_resource_has_changed?() which will delete the resource from an
   offline CIB copy, re-add it and then verify via
   pcmk_restart_resource?() if a restart would take place. The reason we
   need to remove a resource and then re-add it is due to the way pcs
   commands around bundles are limited (you basically can't update a
   bundle with the list of all all the storage-mappings: you have to specify which
   mappings are going to be added and which removed). So the simplest
   way is to just remove the resource and re-add it.

Change-Id: Iba7092b79af3a4dbc2888f35504175d5eb0abcdb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

Ruby 2.5 via https://github.com/ruby/ruby/commit/25d56ea7b7b52dc81af30c92a9a0e2d2dab6ff27
has dropped Dir::Tmpname.make_tmpname. Since we need a random file name
and not a file object let's implement our version of it.

Also use a constant to define the base folder where we dump temporary
CIBs.

Change-Id: I6401fd586c94843398a2806a8013447ffd5b0b75
"}]
commit_message:
Work around ruby 2.5 dropping Dir::Tmpname.make_tmpname

Ruby 2.5 via https://github.com/ruby/ruby/commit/25d56ea7b7b52dc81af30c92a9a0e2d2dab6ff27
has dropped Dir::Tmpname.make_tmpname. Since we need a random file name
and not a file object let's implement our version of it.

Also use a constant to define the base folder where we dump temporary
CIBs.

Change-Id: I6401fd586c94843398a2806a8013447ffd5b0b75

commit_message:
Wrap the logic for creating resource and location_rule in its own function

In order to support resource update we will need to add more complex
logic around resource creation. In preparation for that let's split off
the creation of resources and location_rule in their own function, in
order to simplify the code in the create() functions

Change-Id: I960c72668938566aa83ed36230d4c8af04849317

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-10 16:14:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_bundle/default.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_resource/default.rb'], 'message': 'Change resource/location exists return code and store their return codes in a class instance variable

In this change we do the following:
1) We introduce three constants representing a pacemaker resource's
   state:
   - exists
   - needs update
   - no change needed
2) We make the exist functions return either exists or no change needed
3) We store the result of the exist functions and reuse that value in
   the create function

This is done for mainly two reasons:
A) Allow the create() function to actually distinguish the update and
   the create case, as pacemaker needs a different approach in the two
   cases
B) Avoids a few pcs calls so we do not check again in the create
   function for the existance of resource or location constraint

In later patches we will make use of the special "needs update" return
code when the existing resource needs to be updated.

Change-Id: I514eedb78ca45c5a2aa16decb1faab02db6f7c20
'}]
commit_message:
Change resource/location exists return code and store their return codes in a class instance variable

In this change we do the following:
1) We introduce three constants representing a pacemaker resource's
   state:
   - exists
   - needs update
   - no change needed
2) We make the exist functions return either exists or no change needed
3) We store the result of the exist functions and reuse that value in
   the create function

This is done for mainly two reasons:
A) Allow the create() function to actually distinguish the update and
   the create case, as pacemaker needs a different approach in the two
   cases
B) Avoids a few pcs calls so we do not check again in the create
   function for the existance of resource or location constraint

In later patches we will make use of the special "needs update" return
code when the existing resource needs to be updated.

Change-Id: I514eedb78ca45c5a2aa16decb1faab02db6f7c20

Both in a bundle and in a resource we currently duplicate a bunch of
code in order to prepare the string to pass to pcs to create the
location rule constraint for resources. Let's split out the code to

commit_message:
Move location_rule build to a common function

Both in a bundle and in a resource we currently duplicate a bunch of
code in order to prepare the string to pass to pcs to create the
location rule constraint for resources. Let's split out the code to
create the string in a common function under pcmk_common.

Let's then leverage it from both bundles and resources.

Change-Id: I660cead06b5773aab473da1874e1edf5fb03e95a

commit_message:
Add serverspec to Gemfile

On my F28 without this, I error out like:
An error occurred while loading ./spec/unit/serverspec/type/pacemaker_resource_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'serverspec'

LoadError:
  cannot load such file -- serverspec
 /tmp/bundled_gems/puppet-pacemaker/gems/rspec-puppet-2.6.9/lib/rspec-puppet/monkey_patches.rb:282:in `require'
 /tmp/bundled_gems/puppet-pacemaker/gems/rspec-puppet-2.6.9/lib/rspec-puppet/monkey_patches.rb:282:in `require'
 ./spec/unit/serverspec/type/pacemaker_resource_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

With this addition spec tests run fine.

Change-Id: Ie7223d753b3e5dd4fa6f1c8ca3a19d9835c28256

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_neutron_security_groups.py

Replace stubs.Set with stub_out or mock in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_neutron_security_groups.py.

The 'fake_get_instances_security_groups_bindings' method
in nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_security_groups.py
is only used in test_neutron_security_groups.py.
So the method is moved to test_neutron_security_groups.py.

Change-Id: Ia2857d51f65f2acb0d22bb873461a50f8c9f9ba4
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

Add undercloud upgrades playbook.

This new playbook configures repositories
in the undercloud before upgrade, imports
the needed branch of tripleo-upgrade role
and executes the role.

commit_message:
Get message from websocket instead from zaqarclient directly

Use the websocket api to get and print the real time
ansible execution for minor update instead of using the
zaqarclient call directly.
This is safer and avoid brutal claim of the messages.

Manual conflict resolution on:
tripleoclient/workflows/package_update.py

Closes-Bug: #1757487
Change-Id: I7e324b9e037197082c23a19b4e4b8832daaf5aee
(cherry picked from commit eaa2e9ce75dbc107d9624a2a7325d3d8ec212a0a)
(cherry picked from commit f31795fb7e294295d73604bbb0ab9c22103472cf)

commit_message:
fix tox release note generation

The reno package must now be specified in the test-requirements.txt,
otherwise reno is not installed and the tox venv target can't be used
to generate a release note.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Change-Id: I2d246fc51498912be62e203cb8e457e9a7a0df22

subject: Remove step upload package to oozie/sharelib
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-04-12 14:24:31.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/tests/unit/plugins/vanilla/hadoop2/test_run_scripts.py', 'sahara/plugins/vanilla/hadoop2/run_scripts.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-upload-oozie-sharelib-step-in-vanilla-2.8.2-546b2026e2f5d557.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove step upload package to oozie/sharelib

It is not robust to upload a special package in a common method.
However, because of change from Hadoop(2.8.2 and later)side,
we do need the dependency package "commons-httpclient" in
oozie/sharelib to let oozie work.
This patch removes the uploading step in sahara because there is
a patch 2eedcec728b4f93e4cb226c5137159dcb3ddbfa3 which add
"commons-httpclient" as a dependency to oozie/sharelib.
So when we build the oozie binary package, "commons-httpclient"
will be as a part of it.

Change-Id: I4f20a356efc2dcc51aac2f10105be6aa351f87e8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove step upload package to oozie/sharelib

It is not robust to upload a special package in a common method.
However, because of change from Hadoop(2.8.2 and later)side,
we do need the dependency package "commons-httpclient" in
oozie/sharelib to let oozie work.
This patch removes the uploading step in sahara because there is
a patch 2eedcec728b4f93e4cb226c5137159dcb3ddbfa3 which add
"commons-httpclient" as a dependency to oozie/sharelib.
So when we build the oozie binary package, "commons-httpclient"
will be as a part of it.

Change-Id: I4f20a356efc2dcc51aac2f10105be6aa351f87e8

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py (2)

This patch removes using mox in the following test classes.

* ResizeHelpersTestCase
* CheckVDISizeTestCase
* ShutdownTestCase
* CreateVBDTestCase

Subsequent patches will remove using mox in another test class
in nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py.

Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Move get_stashed_volume_connector to compute.utils

The utility method will be needed in the compute manager in
an upcoming change, so this moves it from a private method
in the compute.api to compute.utils, makes it public and adjusts
tests and such.

As a result, may_have_ports_or_volumes also has to move.

Change-Id: Iedd6be5ef473dcb4f2c465709f3e070ff529f456

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-04-10 15:32:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_neutron.py', 'ironic/common/neutron.py', 'releasenotes/notes/pxe-enabled-ports-check-c1736215dce76e97.yaml'], 'message': 'Check for PXE-enabled ports when creating neutron ports

The function "add_ports_to_network" will create neutron ports for each
PXE-enabled port on task.node to boot the ramdisk. But there is no
check to see if there are any PXE-enabled ports. If there aren't, no
neutron ports will be created and things will fail further down the
pipeline. To fail sooner with an appropriate message, we raise an
exception if there are no PXE-enabled ports for the node.

Story: 2001811
Task: 12546
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>
Change-Id: I96c21e7d842ad929161a0d298a342fdf4a1275e2
'}]
commit_message:
Check for PXE-enabled ports when creating neutron ports

The function "add_ports_to_network" will create neutron ports for each
PXE-enabled port on task.node to boot the ramdisk. But there is no
check to see if there are any PXE-enabled ports. If there aren't, no
neutron ports will be created and things will fail further down the
pipeline. To fail sooner with an appropriate message, we raise an
exception if there are no PXE-enabled ports for the node.

Story: 2001811
Task: 12546
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>
Change-Id: I96c21e7d842ad929161a0d298a342fdf4a1275e2

thread starting at

for more details.

commit_message:
fix lower constraints settings

Some of the lower constraints settings were improperly set, and that
blocks us from changing any other dependency settings until they are
fixed.

Change-Id: Id6294f463ede7583766affde4099db30922c40a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Clean up SegmentError messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 21:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/request_helpers.py'], 'message': 'Clean up SegmentError messages

Since we already deducted the full length of the chunk from bytes_left
before raising the too-many-bytes error, the value in the error message
was always negative, like

    Too many bytes for /v1/AUTH_test/c%3Fwith-question-mark/dlo;
    truncating in /v1/AUTH_test/c with -27244 bytes left

In the not-enough-bytes case, we may as well mention how many more bytes
we were expecting.

Change-Id: I155ed1837d40b4aaf929452b830f03c1daab0af7
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up SegmentError messages

Since we already deducted the full length of the chunk from bytes_left
before raising the too-many-bytes error, the value in the error message
was always negative, like

    Too many bytes for /v1/AUTH_test/c%3Fwith-question-mark/dlo;
    truncating in /v1/AUTH_test/c with -27244 bytes left

In the not-enough-bytes case, we may as well mention how many more bytes
we were expecting.

Change-Id: I155ed1837d40b4aaf929452b830f03c1daab0af7

commit_message:
xenapi: Support live migration in pooled multi-nodes environment

The previous implementation doesn't support live migration in
pool-based multi-hosts OpenStack environments. Modify code to
support it.
In this patch we will,
1. Support live migration in XAPI pool:
    -Add code to support resource pre-check before live migration.
    -Add code to support resource clean after live migration.
    -Add code to support using local storage in xapi pool.

Depends-On: I80007bb897a1f7eda47ebda82e08fe270f97ff40
Implements: blueprint live-migration-in-xapi-pool
Change-Id: I6437a315f1400a73f7a149bed5550f6d6dd1406f

commit_message:
Update README, beat deployment, and configs

Beat set is using a loop to ship both templates and dashboards using
different commands. This is being done to ensure no data is lost or
mis-setup during index creation.

Packetbeat only needs to be installed on hosts

All of the beats are now using standard field templates.

Change-Id: Ie6220eb94a12780ad122ba367bf7654d97c212e8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Add container/service clean up for nova/cinder/heat
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-04-09 20:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/upgrades/major-upgrades-manual-upgrade.rst', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/cleanup-nova.yml', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/cleanup-heat.yml', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/cleanup-cinder.yml', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'releasenotes/notes/hyperconverged-containers-31c413e94c4e2902.yaml'], 'message': 'Add container/service clean up for nova/cinder/heat

When upgrading from pike to queens there are the following
changes to the container/service setup:

1. All cinder container services are consolidated into
   a single cinder_api_container. The previously implemented
   cinder_scheduler_container can be removed.

2. A new heat_api container is created with all heat services
   running in it. The previously implemented heat_apis_container
   and heat_engine_container can be removed.

3. All nova services are consolidated into the nova_api_container
   and the rest of the nova containers can be removed.

This patch implements the automation into the run-upgrade script
in order to automate these changes. Each cleanup execution is
also usable outside of the run-upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id1341133744988a3f3db1fd4ce1a306f389de4cc
Co-Authored-By: Florian Haas <florian@citynetwork.eu>
Implements: blueprint hyperconverged-containers
'}]
commit_message:
Add container/service clean up for nova/cinder/heat

When upgrading from pike to queens there are the following
changes to the container/service setup:

1. All cinder container services are consolidated into
   a single cinder_api_container. The previously implemented
   cinder_scheduler_container can be removed.

2. A new heat_api container is created with all heat services
   running in it. The previously implemented heat_apis_container
   and heat_engine_container can be removed.

3. All nova services are consolidated into the nova_api_container
   and the rest of the nova containers can be removed.

This patch implements the automation into the run-upgrade script
in order to automate these changes. Each cleanup execution is
also usable outside of the run-upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id1341133744988a3f3db1fd4ce1a306f389de4cc
Co-Authored-By: Florian Haas <florian@citynetwork.eu>
Implements: blueprint hyperconverged-containers

commit_message:
Add Neutron L3 agent failover check during upgrade

This change adds suppport for validating that a router created on
the overcloud before upgrade remains active on the same node between
the various steps of the upgrade process and does not failover.

Change-Id: I1273367fb07bda5cdacb538081a87f9d3e5ece3c

subject: Sync hacking requirement with ironic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 20:36:15.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44
"}]
commit_message:
Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44

commit_message:
Remove :return from update_provider_tree docstring

During development of update_provider_tree, it was decided that we don't
need it to return anything - deciding whether things have changed is
handled by the report client.

But somehow we missed removing that bit from the docstring.  This patch
remedies that.

related to blueprint update-provider-tree

Change-Id: I199a13b0a3de9f1cbe3f6419506fe7b37ed6c4ae

commit_message:
fix tox release note generation

The reno package must now be specified in the test-requirements.txt,
otherwise reno is not installed and the tox venv target can't be used
to generate a release note.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Change-Id: I114b01c37428a08b6297bb49d1aa3d6678a966f6

subject: Use hostnames in inventory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-04-09 19:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/utils/config.py', 'tripleo_common/inventory.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/test_inventory.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use-hostnames-in-inventory-6d1a3572baebf509.yaml'], 'message': 'Use hostnames in inventory

This patch updates the inventory code to produce an inventory that uses
hostnames as the host alias. Since the hostname may not always be
resolvable, ansible_host is added as a hostvar and set to the host's IP
address.

Using hostnames produces a much more user friendly result in the ansible
output showing task result and play recap.

The anti-pattern of creating one group per host is also removed in favor
of just adding additional hosts under the role named groups. E.g., the
"Controller" group will now contain 3 hosts when deploying 3 controllers
instead of having 3 child groups, where each child group only had 1
host.

hostvars are again used to set specific values on each host in the role
named group.

Change-Id: If834e5e60f79a7418cbc1441d2aaf85507ac7bd2
Closes-Bug: #1752057
'}]
commit_message:
Use hostnames in inventory

This patch updates the inventory code to produce an inventory that uses
hostnames as the host alias. Since the hostname may not always be
resolvable, ansible_host is added as a hostvar and set to the host's IP
address.

Using hostnames produces a much more user friendly result in the ansible
output showing task result and play recap.

The anti-pattern of creating one group per host is also removed in favor
of just adding additional hosts under the role named groups. E.g., the
"Controller" group will now contain 3 hosts when deploying 3 controllers
instead of having 3 child groups, where each child group only had 1
host.

hostvars are again used to set specific values on each host in the role
named group.

Change-Id: If834e5e60f79a7418cbc1441d2aaf85507ac7bd2
Closes-Bug: #1752057

dmidecode can return some additional data if SMBIOS is updated. Let's
ensure that the expected output matches the expected UUID format. The
expected string from the 'dmidecode --s system-uuid' call should look
like "79287E4C-2FBF-11B2-A85C-EB9FB9250CBA".

Closes-Bug: #1762460

commit_message:
Sanitize the uuid string

dmidecode can return some additional data if SMBIOS is updated. Let's
ensure that the expected output matches the expected UUID format. The
expected string from the 'dmidecode --s system-uuid' call should look
like "79287E4C-2FBF-11B2-A85C-EB9FB9250CBA".

Change-Id: Ib0d19e64b2f24f4a9229f8868795e8979e267f04
Closes-Bug: #1762460

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-04-12 15:10:01.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "haproxy: enable UI on containerized undercloud

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
for instack-undercloud.
It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

For backward compatibility, we'll keep support for enable_ui and use

before.

Change-Id: I2f9ef89b6daac2dec4e2af110f5d239a3611f747
"}]
commit_message:
haproxy: enable UI on containerized undercloud

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
for instack-undercloud.
It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

For backward compatibility, we'll keep support for enable_ui and use
pick to find which one is defined, otherwise we'll just disable it like
before.

Change-Id: I2f9ef89b6daac2dec4e2af110f5d239a3611f747

subject: Multiprocess object replicator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 22:55:24.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'swift/common/daemon.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_daemon.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'etc/object-server.conf-sample'], 'message': 'Multiprocess object replicator

Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the
"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so
operators can tell which messages came from which worker. It looks
like this:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

Drive-by fix: don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain
policies. When running the object replicator with replicator_workers >
0 and "--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats
after running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions.

Change-Id: I9c63bd8d8f8b0630c1061402ccc65b7dd4238891
'}]
commit_message:
Multiprocess object replicator

Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the
"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so
operators can tell which messages came from which worker. It looks
like this:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

Drive-by fix: don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain
policies. When running the object replicator with replicator_workers >
0 and "--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats
after running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions.

Change-Id: I9c63bd8d8f8b0630c1061402ccc65b7dd4238891

subject: Refactor replicator command-line-argument handling
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-07 00:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Refactor replicator command-line-argument handling

Between the account replicator, container replicator, object
replicator, and object reconstructor, we had a couple different ways
of handling --devices, --partitions, and --policies arguments. This
commit refactors them to all use the same helper method.

This will probably be helpful in making the account and container
replicators support multiple worker processes.

Change-Id: I4c642fbcfdfe4a6f91dd4ffdd87ec6c1937f95ca
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor replicator command-line-argument handling

Between the account replicator, container replicator, object
replicator, and object reconstructor, we had a couple different ways
of handling --devices, --partitions, and --policies arguments. This
commit refactors them to all use the same helper method.

This will probably be helpful in making the account and container
replicators support multiple worker processes.

Change-Id: I4c642fbcfdfe4a6f91dd4ffdd87ec6c1937f95ca

subject: Don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain policies
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-06 19:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain policies

When running the object replicator with replicator_workers > 0 and
"--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats after
running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions. This commit makes it not update recon in
that case.

Change-Id: I574e5fd5c22bfb52f78f876b9704fe18ff951c63
'}]
commit_message:
Don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain policies

When running the object replicator with replicator_workers > 0 and
"--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats after
running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions. This commit makes it not update recon in
that case.

Change-Id: I574e5fd5c22bfb52f78f876b9704fe18ff951c63

subject: Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-06 18:44:17.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable

When a bunch of object-replicator worker processes are all going at
the same time, their logs get mixed together and it is hard to see
what each one is doing. This is especially true with the stats line,
which contains an estimated completion time.

This commit adds a prefix to the log messages from each worker
process. Example:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

I had considered putting the override devices in there, but that list
can get rather long on systems with many drives but few replicator
workers. Combined with the log-line length limit, that could end up
crowding out the useful parts of log messages. That's why I opted for
just the worker index.

Change-Id: If3ced6b7d0d00e11ed8dcdd040077614ea07c179
'}]
commit_message:
Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable

When a bunch of object-replicator worker processes are all going at
the same time, their logs get mixed together and it is hard to see
what each one is doing. This is especially true with the stats line,
which contains an estimated completion time.

This commit adds a prefix to the log messages from each worker
process. Example:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

I had considered putting the override devices in there, but that list
can get rather long on systems with many drives but few replicator
workers. Combined with the log-line length limit, that could end up
crowding out the useful parts of log messages. That's why I opted for
just the worker index.

Change-Id: If3ced6b7d0d00e11ed8dcdd040077614ea07c179

subject: Cleanups for multiprocess object replicator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-10 19:26:36.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Cleanups for multiprocess object replicator

Made utils.load_recon_cache() robust to invalid JSON, plus tests. Also
added tests for missing recon file.

Made obj.replicator.Stats robust to new fields on disk in
object.recon. Small refactorings in Stats class. It ended up being
halfway to collections.namedtuple(), but going all the way to
namedtuple made things uglier (IMO), so it remains namedtuple-ish.

Removed one-line _stats_for_dev method on object replicator and just
used self.stats_for_dev[dev] instead.

Change-Id: Idecf5d9050ceb14fabd755275b7c72944bbed9ec
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanups for multiprocess object replicator

Made utils.load_recon_cache() robust to invalid JSON, plus tests. Also
added tests for missing recon file.

Made obj.replicator.Stats robust to new fields on disk in
object.recon. Small refactorings in Stats class. It ended up being
halfway to collections.namedtuple(), but going all the way to
namedtuple made things uglier (IMO), so it remains namedtuple-ish.

Removed one-line _stats_for_dev method on object replicator and just
used self.stats_for_dev[dev] instead.

Change-Id: Idecf5d9050ceb14fabd755275b7c72944bbed9ec

subject: Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-20 15:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I9cc50095b7b9a151184f131b1a4735da6c3f83dd
'}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I9cc50095b7b9a151184f131b1a4735da6c3f83dd

commit_message:
versioned object plugin registry

This patch implements the plumbing to support dynamically loadable
plugins for neutron versioned objects as per the spec [1]. Specifically
a utility class is introduced as a generic plugin manager for stevedore
based plugins in a given namespace. A global singleton instance of this
plugin manager is then wrapped to provide access to neutron versioned
objects.

Using this implementation:
- Neutron version object classes are registered as entry points. For
example [2].
- Consumers can then use the object registry in neutron_lib to access
them, for example [3].

As-is this change doesn't introduce any breakage risk; it's new
functionality that no one is using.

[1] I079d06502e6e7b1e20aea882979b0ecd9106eaeb
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553836/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553835/

Change-Id: I39d9bab1e24fbcbd5f9b3abf80560da920f1cf26

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 13:54:51.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Make the nova-multiattach job non-voting temporarily

Since Icb971831c8d4fe5f940d9e7993d53f1c3765e30f merged
in devstack to use the Queens UCA, the nova-multiattach
job has been failing to start nova-compute due to permission
errors connecting to libvirt, which probably has something
to do with the stack user not having access to the proper
libvirt(d) group.

It's weird since this was working in change
I0962474ff6dfc5fa97670c09a1af97a0f34cd54f to make the

Related-Bug: #1763382
"}]
commit_message:
Make the nova-multiattach job non-voting temporarily

Since Icb971831c8d4fe5f940d9e7993d53f1c3765e30f merged
in devstack to use the Queens UCA, the nova-multiattach
job has been failing to start nova-compute due to permission
errors connecting to libvirt, which probably has something
to do with the stack user not having access to the proper
libvirt(d) group.

It's weird since this was working in change
I0962474ff6dfc5fa97670c09a1af97a0f34cd54f to make the
nova-multiattach job use the Queens UCA.

Anyway, let's make it non-voting to stop the bleeding while
we can figure out the actual problem.

Change-Id: I3911c902cecfa8e66fccffd9fe0e4f462eacd588
Related-Bug: #1763382

list

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job

- Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.
- Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.
- Add a lower-constraints job that runs unit tests with a Py35
environment constrained by lower bounds.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I000e03759f7a5065c96493c0064785a1f010de4e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ief2fecbc266adcc816336b601253d3e90c39c32b
Closes-Bug: #1763300

commit_message:
Fix constraints and uncap eventlets

Some lower-constraints did not match the lower bounds in the
requirements file(s).

Details at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2c9978041206d31b191f8d2bbc34b18d93411472
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560466

revisions. :(

attach nova instances to flat networks.  This should be allowed by
default.

commit_message:
Remove config.json for old style nic config files when using new style

This removes the config.json used by os-apply-config for old style nic
config files in the script invoked for new style nic config files.
This will avoid the case when the network files are set up by
run-os-net-config.sh and then later overwritten by os-apply-config.

Change-Id: I8f17a53c392aac657b00afdecbb5e58a2e192787
Closes-Bug: 1758161
(cherry picked from commit 9f4c691ccae4be6aa93e40450717b35f16a2a655)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 02:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['accessbot/channels.yaml'], 'message': "Remove openstack-101 from accessbot

In discussions at the last PTG[1] and in subsequent First Contact
SIG meetings[2] we've decided that the #openstack-101 channel
should be removed and rolled into the #openstack-dev channel.

Why? Good qustion:
 - No one is good at sitting in and watching the #openstack-101
   channel outside of OUI training periods.
 - It would be better for new contributors to ask questions in
   a channel that people with the answers already activly monitor.
 - 101 is an American-ism, that not everyone in the world would
   understand.

This means that during OUI trainings there will be more noise in
openstack-dev. However, trainings mostly happen the weekend
before a summit, so at a very quiet time. And would mean trainees
would already have practice and now where to come for questions.

There is another patch[3] which will remove openstack-101 from
the status and meet bots.

Finally, as per renaming instructions[4], once these patches
land, a redirect will need to be created, the topic updated and
current residents of the channel will need to be informed to
relocate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/FC_SIG_Rocky_PTG

commit_message:
Remove openstack-101 from accessbot

In discussions at the last PTG[1] and in subsequent First Contact
SIG meetings[2] we've decided that the #openstack-101 channel
should be removed and rolled into the #openstack-dev channel.

Why? Good qustion:
 - No one is good at sitting in and watching the #openstack-101
   channel outside of OUI training periods.
 - It would be better for new contributors to ask questions in
   a channel that people with the answers already activly monitor.
 - 101 is an American-ism, that not everyone in the world would
   understand.

This means that during OUI trainings there will be more noise in
openstack-dev. However, trainings mostly happen the weekend
before a summit, so at a very quiet time. And would mean trainees
would already have practice and now where to come for questions.

There is another patch[3] which will remove openstack-101 from
the status and meet bots.

Finally, as per renaming instructions[4], once these patches
land, a redirect will need to be created, the topic updated and
current residents of the channel will need to be informed to
relocate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/FC_SIG_Rocky_PTG
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG#Meeting_Agenda
[3] https://review.openstack.org/559249
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Change-Id: Ic63184138d361f6a5da0eed8446c166fee446833

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-12 04:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['openvswitch/templates/bin/_openvswitch-db-server.sh.tpl', 'openvswitch/templates/bin/_openvswitch-vswitchd.sh.tpl'], 'message': 'openvswitch: use pidfile option

Make appctl to search pidfile for exit command as pid 1 is not
always the target process in some cases. For example, pid 1 is

Change-Id: I90e202245a9522fe53bea7e1f047061a0a280834
'}]
commit_message:
openvswitch: use pidfile option

Make appctl to search pidfile for exit command as pid 1 is not
always the target process in some cases. For example, pid 1 is
"pause" when pid namespace sharing is enabled in your k8s cluster.

Change-Id: I90e202245a9522fe53bea7e1f047061a0a280834

subject: Shard range updates should not revive deleted container
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Shard range updates should not revive deleted container

...unless they have non-zero object stats.

Before, *any* shard range update received by a deleted container would
bump its put timestamp and revive it. Now, shard range updates do not
bump the put timestamp, but are still accepted by a deleted
container. If the shard range update has non-zero object count then
the container will be revived, just as if an object update had been
received after the delete timestamp. Otherwise the container will
remain deleted.

Shard range updates will still autocreate a container in the .shards
account namespace.

Unlike object updates, shard range updates may also update container
metadata.

Change-Id: If48e588783bc02104b2405169bd69bc3219572d4
'}]
commit_message:
Shard range updates should not revive deleted container

...unless they have non-zero object stats.

Before, *any* shard range update received by a deleted container would
bump its put timestamp and revive it. Now, shard range updates do not
bump the put timestamp, but are still accepted by a deleted
container. If the shard range update has non-zero object count then
the container will be revived, just as if an object update had been
received after the delete timestamp. Otherwise the container will
remain deleted.

Shard range updates will still autocreate a container in the .shards
account namespace.

Unlike object updates, shard range updates may also update container
metadata.

Change-Id: If48e588783bc02104b2405169bd69bc3219572d4

subject: remove lower bounds from global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-11 14:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py', 'openstack_requirements/requirement.py'], 'message': 'remove lower bounds from global requirements

Now that we allow projects to diverge in their lower bounds, it no
longer makes sense for us to track "global" lower bounds values. We
need to retain the exclusion specifiers (using the "!=" operator) so
that the automatic constraint update calculation continues to produce
a set of values that we expect to work.

In addition to updating the data, this patch updates the validation
rules so that if a lower bound is included an error is reported.

Change-Id: If9da4636755fc089b2ec5f075e03767f84c34a67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove lower bounds from global requirements

Now that we allow projects to diverge in their lower bounds, it no
longer makes sense for us to track "global" lower bounds values. We
need to retain the exclusion specifiers (using the "!=" operator) so
that the automatic constraint update calculation continues to produce
a set of values that we expect to work.

In addition to updating the data, this patch updates the validation
rules so that if a lower bound is included an error is reported.

Change-Id: If9da4636755fc089b2ec5f075e03767f84c34a67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

This reverts commit dad6bee340fa15b07cfddcdd79e58ab070c0549d.

commit_message:
Revert "Allow to clone extras if zuul cloner is not presented"

This reverts commit dad6bee340fa15b07cfddcdd79e58ab070c0549d.

With dad6bee340fa15b07cfddcdd79e58ab070c0549d, jobs were not picking up 
the tripleo-quickstart-extras changes from ZUUL.
Looking at jobs, tripleo-quickstart-extras changes were not being 
deployed to /usr/local/share/ansible/roles.

With the change reverted, the jobs work again.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560112/- which depends on the 
revert to test this.

Change-Id: I24fd5534125986c76708c01838d80a9427a660f4

commit_message:
Bug fix: fwaas_v2 was missing in the pip task

Closes-Bug:#1752073

The neutron_optional_fwaas_pip_packages was never used because only
neutron_fwaas was checked. This patch adds neutron_fwaas_v2 to the
list

subject: Fix the checking of directories for extensions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 17:43:05.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_titles.py'], 'message': 'Fix the checking of directories for extensions

The test for file extensions was checking everything returned by
glob.glob("guidelines/*"). The recent merge of the refactored HTTP
guidelines added a new guidelines/http/ directory, and the test was
failing because that entry didn't end with either .rst or .json. This
patch corrects that by skipping directories from that name check.

Change-Id: I0a84160015e9c1d96cb456b07c5e45fc6645df08
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the checking of directories for extensions

The test for file extensions was checking everything returned by
glob.glob("guidelines/*"). The recent merge of the refactored HTTP
guidelines added a new guidelines/http/ directory, and the test was
failing because that entry didn't end with either .rst or .json. This
patch corrects that by skipping directories from that name check.

Change-Id: I0a84160015e9c1d96cb456b07c5e45fc6645df08

commit_message:
Convert infra-puppet-apply jobs to non-legacy

This patch moves the infra-puppet-apply jobs out of legacy/ and into
jobs.yaml. It also condenses the four different run playbooks and four
different post playbooks into one run playbook and one post playbook
since they were all identical. This includes the infra-puppet-apply-4
playbook. A future patch will implement a puppet 4 playbook properly as
an experimental job.

The job configuration remains centralized in openstack-zuul-jobs rather
than in the individual puppet module repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557507
Change-Id: Icb705a5af11afa01ec889ec28b3cf5ef29ab4a11

commit_message:
remove unused common exceptions

This patch removes a handful of unused exceptions from
neutron.common.exceptions as follows:

The following exceptions already live in neutron-lib and are thus
duplicates in neutron:
PlacementEndpointNotFound
PlacementResourceProviderNotFound
PlacementInventoryNotFound
PlacementAggregateNotFound
PlacementInventoryUpdateConflict
NetworkVlanRangeError
PhysicalNetworkNameError
MacAddressGenerationFailure

The following exception is not used anywhere today:
TenantNetworksDisabled

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ie8227954681292ead1da0dedc950c54028ce84f1

subject: Add debian-stable nodeset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 13:18:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/nodesets.yaml'], 'message': "Add debian-stable nodeset

Today debian stretch is the current stable release of debian:

  https://wiki.debian.org/DebianReleases

Rather then adding debian-stretch as our default nodeset label, use
debian-stable. This should aid in the transition to debian-buster once
it is released. Since we don't plan to support long term releases of
debian, we can just update this nodeset once we are ready to switch to
buster over updating all projects intree jobs.

Change-Id: I91de606c52bd0571a04da7820214f5ed75c2caa7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add debian-stable nodeset

Today debian stretch is the current stable release of debian:

  https://wiki.debian.org/DebianReleases

Rather then adding debian-stretch as our default nodeset label, use
debian-stable. This should aid in the transition to debian-buster once
it is released. Since we don't plan to support long term releases of
debian, we can just update this nodeset once we are ready to switch to
buster over updating all projects intree jobs.

Change-Id: I91de606c52bd0571a04da7820214f5ed75c2caa7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Install client from pip if not in LIBS_FROM_GIT

It shouldn't be a requirement to put python-octaviaclient into
LIBS_FROM_GIT in local.conf. This commit makes Octavia's DevStack plugin
install it from pip if it's not present in LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Story: 2001830
Task: 12587
Change-Id: I37014a766e27f6117c96aef976fa1e0b5a9ca031

commit_message:
Pause ubuntu-xenial DIBs

We are seeing an issue with ubuntu-xenial DIBs in rackspace. Pause
nodepool-builder so we can revert to the previous days images until we
can properly debug the reason for the failure.

Change-Id: I8aa0e6efedb11f47eceb1a9961f84dbe609bfdcd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I65df598a852fdb75cebc0bb49c7aa7a0e7d7ab8c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-04-12 02:30:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_casual_args.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Replace insecure function eval

In neutronclient we use a eval function for processing
CLI neutron arguments. This function possible insecure because
eval get argument from client side. Instead of it we can use
a dict with allowed types which is more secure.

Closes-Bug: #1762938
Change-Id: Idde55d1b9206e9ef8742464825709f098d488a8e
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Replace insecure function eval

In neutronclient we use a eval function for processing
CLI neutron arguments. This function possible insecure because
eval get argument from client side. Instead of it we can use
a dict with allowed types which is more secure.

Closes-Bug: #1762938
Change-Id: Idde55d1b9206e9ef8742464825709f098d488a8e
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

subject: uncap eventlet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 16:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "uncap eventlet

This is the first step in the process...

1. uncap eventlet (this review)
2. push uncapped eventlet out via requirements updates to all consumers
3. make review in requirements changing upper-constraints.txt for
   eventlet
4. projects depend on requirements change to do work on the new eventlet
   the patch generated should merge into project without the
   requirements change merged (this means the change should pass in the
   dependant review (to test 0.22.1) AND in a separate non-dependant
   review (test the current constraint).  You would merge the
   non-dependant once both reviews are passing.
5. Once some non-determined set of projects work with the new eventlet
   we'd merge the updated upper-constraint into requirements.

Change-Id: Ia7d00e9cddca7908bc3c3ae64a58704fc4b27350
"}]
commit_message:
uncap eventlet

This is the first step in the process...

1. uncap eventlet (this review)
2. push uncapped eventlet out via requirements updates to all consumers
3. make review in requirements changing upper-constraints.txt for
   eventlet
4. projects depend on requirements change to do work on the new eventlet
   the patch generated should merge into project without the
   requirements change merged (this means the change should pass in the
   dependant review (to test 0.22.1) AND in a separate non-dependant
   review (test the current constraint).  You would merge the
   non-dependant once both reviews are passing.
5. Once some non-determined set of projects work with the new eventlet
   we'd merge the updated upper-constraint into requirements.

Change-Id: Ia7d00e9cddca7908bc3c3ae64a58704fc4b27350

commit_message:
Run playbooks with custom args

Add support to run each playbook with its custom args to override
default ones. Required in upgrades jobs to override release vars
when running upgrade playbook.

commit_message:
Add CACerts service to all scenario environment files

This service is needed to install CA certificates for the overcloud. We
need it because the plan is to enable public TLS by default. And without
this it won't work.

Change-Id: I168e6a543f7143900fdb855ec29d8532fb9736ae

subject: test-install-keystone: Do not hardcode path for keystone-manage binary
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-11 16:03:14.000000000', 'files': ['test-install-keystone.yml'], 'message': "test-install-keystone: Do not hardcode path for keystone-manage binary

When using the keystone distribution packages, the keystone binaries are
no longer installed in a virtual environment so we shouldn't hardcode
the paths to these binaries. It's preferred to set the PATH env variable
with all the possible paths and just call the binaries directly.

Change-Id: I1f5431bacc308b007b992a8b41bd4bd19635d551
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}]
commit_message:
test-install-keystone: Do not hardcode path for keystone-manage binary

When using the keystone distribution packages, the keystone binaries are
no longer installed in a virtual environment so we shouldn't hardcode
the paths to these binaries. It's preferred to set the PATH env variable
with all the possible paths and just call the binaries directly.

Change-Id: I1f5431bacc308b007b992a8b41bd4bd19635d551
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Update OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronCorePlugin for containers

Neutron ML2 plugin has been containerized, we need to switch
ComputeNeutronCorePlugin to use the containerized service in THT for the
Neutron ML2 plugin, otherwise Neutron will be configured on the host and
not in the container.

Change-Id: I744cde656cc827762b13995d05f8881d4da2b5b8
Closes-Bug: #1762504

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 07:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['templates/oooq_deploy_transformation.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Fix a nit in the oooq transformation process.

This would result in a file having the compute node and the

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/55/559755/3/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-container-to-container-upgrades-master-nv/Zd4c2be456ed34d239b58e830288b2421/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.txt.gz

commit_message:
Fix a nit in the oooq transformation process.

This would result in a file having the compute node and the
environment files on the same line:

  --compute-scale 0  -e /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/test-environments/worker-config.yaml \

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/55/559755/3/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-container-to-container-upgrades-master-nv/Zd4c2be456ed34d239b58e830288b2421/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5e9cf01e706411406b953d4c1a8e7443b328edd2
(cherry picked from commit ca46430dd2ea85fc34ea39fdc76cca4cab61b7f2)

commit_message:
Pass the execution id to AnsibleAction

In order to read the queue with the websocket
the execution id should be not None

Manual cherry pick
(Cherry-pick from: ef286afe5a2783c33c280507558474b23bce83dc)
