[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-10 11:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstackgaterc', 'zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': 'Make tempest API/Scenario tests voting

This patch is making the tempest API and scenario tests voting in gate.
This is highly desired because a non-voting job doesn't always get the
attention it needs.

Right now only the "test_router_interface_status" is currently failing
due to a known bug which is being tracked at [0]. I've disabled it and
left a FIXME not to remove the regex once the bug is fixed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1713835

Depends-On: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc
Change-Id: I2226e06e5b819ff39189cc125563dc1f3d1f93af
'}]
commit_message:
Make tempest API/Scenario tests voting

This patch is making the tempest API and scenario tests voting in gate.
This is highly desired because a non-voting job doesn't always get the
attention it needs.

Right now only the "test_router_interface_status" is currently failing
due to a known bug which is being tracked at [0]. I've disabled it and
left a FIXME not to remove the regex once the bug is fixed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1713835

Depends-On: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc
Change-Id: I2226e06e5b819ff39189cc125563dc1f3d1f93af

Prepare for the Image API v1 to be removed from glance during Rocky
by splitting the functional tests that hit v1 from the tests that hit
v2.  Introduce a new job that runs the functional-v1 tests against a
devstack running glance stable/queens, and configure this job for both
check and gate for the glanceclient.  The v2 functional tests
continue to be run for both check and gate against a devstack running
glance master.

Change-Id: Ifa98ada26a84e4cca3ea8c98173f61a6174cca27

commit_message:
Split glanceclient functional tests

Prepare for the Image API v1 to be removed from glance during Rocky
by splitting the functional tests that hit v1 from the tests that hit
v2.  Introduce a new job that runs the functional-v1 tests against a
devstack running glance stable/queens, and configure this job for both
check and gate for the glanceclient.  The v2 functional tests
continue to be run for both check and gate against a devstack running
glance master.

Change-Id: Ifa98ada26a84e4cca3ea8c98173f61a6174cca27

commit_message:
Strip the version prefix from the next link for pagination

keystoneauth1 appends the version prefix to the url causing the
pagination url to be incorrect when using the url prefix from
next link. Thus we are stripping the version prefix from the
next link for pagination to work correctly

Change-Id: Iad8e69d20783cfe59c3e86bd6980da7dee802869
Closes-Bug: 1748534

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Magnum. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'etcd_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Magnum project is cloned
and bindmounted.

subject: Add haproxy_tcp_request_inspect_delay config
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-04 01:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/config.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/sample_configs/sample_configs.py', 'octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/jinja_cfg.py', 'octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/templates/macros.j2', 'etc/octavia.conf', 'releasenotes/notes/tcp_request_inspect_delay-cb60beaf8b6c4ff7.yaml'], 'message': 'Add haproxy_tcp_request_inspect_delay config

If a user setup a TCP listener and then applied L7 rules to the listener
connections may fall through to the default pool even though they match the
L7 rule(s). This is because with a TCP listener HAProxy inspects the first
packet received with no delay. This first packet may not include the header
information required to match the L7 rule.
This patch add a configuration setting that allows the operator to specify the
delay time HAProxy will wait for additional TCP packets before it gives up
on matching the L7 rule(s).
This setting is off by default and is only enabled for TCP listeners with
L7 rules. Enabling it may inject artificial delay into processing TCP flows
when L7 rules are enabled on TCP listeners.
To avoid this delay, when using HTTP based L7 rules, specify an HTTP listener.

Change-Id: Ide52d77e993ae30675f6faf08a85bc9d2d61f135
Story: 2001425
Task: 6131
'}]
commit_message:
Add haproxy_tcp_request_inspect_delay config

If a user setup a TCP listener and then applied L7 rules to the listener
connections may fall through to the default pool even though they match the
L7 rule(s). This is because with a TCP listener HAProxy inspects the first
packet received with no delay. This first packet may not include the header
information required to match the L7 rule.
This patch add a configuration setting that allows the operator to specify the
delay time HAProxy will wait for additional TCP packets before it gives up
on matching the L7 rule(s).
This setting is off by default and is only enabled for TCP listeners with
L7 rules. Enabling it may inject artificial delay into processing TCP flows
when L7 rules are enabled on TCP listeners.
To avoid this delay, when using HTTP based L7 rules, specify an HTTP listener.

Change-Id: Ide52d77e993ae30675f6faf08a85bc9d2d61f135
Story: 2001425
Task: 6131

subject: Allow for more overhead in zaqar message
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-04-12 11:07:33.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_ansible.py'], 'message': "Allow for more overhead in zaqar message

We need to account for more overhad when chunking the message before
posting it to the zaqar queue as JSON encoding also adds to the overall
message length. This changes the overhead ratio from 90% down to 50%.

This would result in more smaller messages going through the queue. I
don't see any drawbacks with that though given this zaqar is not tenant
facing and is on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I79535bb276a7f763da575a022486590c117579b0
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for more overhead in zaqar message

We need to account for more overhad when chunking the message before
posting it to the zaqar queue as JSON encoding also adds to the overall
message length. This changes the overhead ratio from 90% down to 50%.

This would result in more smaller messages going through the queue. I
don't see any drawbacks with that though given this zaqar is not tenant
facing and is on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I79535bb276a7f763da575a022486590c117579b0

subject: Add support for key manager configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 15:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_utils.py', 'ceph/utils.py'], 'message': "Add support for key manager configuration

A support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: Icdde1f128641573d7e49796961e63508b715e18b
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for key manager configuration

A support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: Icdde1f128641573d7e49796961e63508b715e18b

subject: Don't persist RequestSpec.retry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 16:05:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1718512.py'], 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
(cherry picked from commit 4afa8c2b97929faaf8bbf2bbaa72235fab7d3d13)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
(cherry picked from commit 4afa8c2b97929faaf8bbf2bbaa72235fab7d3d13)

commit_message:
Run with KVM if we can in tests

We should not Set nova_virt_type.
This way detection steps in, and kvm is used.

However, we should use qemu for OVH hosts:
There seem to be a bug in some OVH hosts
causing 'hardware error 0x0' when trying to run with kvm.

This is a manual-cherry pick of the following commits:

Allow to run tests outside openstack infra:
  I782bc40a6ce192b705d7d08a578fdf6275b9a13e
Run with KVM if we can in tests:
  I4f679815ac55095000dc1017cebbd1a8bf0f6c5f
Use the right hypervisor name for ovh hosts:
  Ib07a93db1d0f826701fd58f95243eb17ef017e4b

(cherry picked from commit 17439c210cfdf1b22980cb68db3d29dbb41963eb)
(cherry picked from commit b3a5751048bcfd9b4eb176591ce3f735ea05bc86)
(cherry picked from commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0)
(cherry picked from commit 41c59c7908cd728a74cfac10c03150020b4d8729)
(cherry picked from commit 5d161fb73176e92b0097f615700275918714f27c)

Change-Id: I7a5e15f84d4cd7b3a121a2275cd4ab7b961829f5

commit_message:
Initial support for Prometheus monitoring

This adds support for running a Prometheus server and a few exporters
that already have existing Kolla images (node exporter, haproxy exporter
and mysqld exporter).

Partially-Implements: blueprint prometheus
Change-Id: I69e648c05b2bb27aa2f5973dec3a58b75850eeee

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaeed4026962e635f68013ff8d175f0e20bffe415
Closes-Bug: #1763300

subject: sphinxext: Start parsing 'Opt.help' as rST
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-20 15:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/sphinxext.py'], 'message': "sphinxext: Start parsing 'Opt.help' as rST

Users expect this to be parsed as rST and write their docstrings
accordingly. This has the potential to introduce warnings for users with
improperly formatted rST and these warnings can be promoted to errors if
'sphinx-build' is used with the '-W' option. As a result, we disable the
'warning-is-error' logger for these options. We may wish to change this
behavior in the future.

It is not really possible to test this yet as the output wouldn't look
much different. In addition, the error messages generated are rather
unhelpful. Both of these can be changed in a future modification.

Change-Id: Ic6c2dcbe7823dd3fdc71db8dc5afab2d604559e3
Closes-Bug: #1755783
"}]
commit_message:
sphinxext: Start parsing 'Opt.help' as rST

Users expect this to be parsed as rST and write their docstrings
accordingly. This has the potential to introduce warnings for users with
improperly formatted rST and these warnings can be promoted to errors if
'sphinx-build' is used with the '-W' option. As a result, we disable the
'warning-is-error' logger for these options. We may wish to change this
behavior in the future.

It is not really possible to test this yet as the output wouldn't look
much different. In addition, the error messages generated are rather
unhelpful. Both of these can be changed in a future modification.

Change-Id: Ic6c2dcbe7823dd3fdc71db8dc5afab2d604559e3
Closes-Bug: #1755783

subject: Several manage_shard_ranges improvements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 05:34:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'swift/cli/manage_shard_ranges.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4

commit_message:
Restrict legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job

The legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job isn't relevant to
documentation or release notes changes, so save resources by
not running it on such jobs.

For example, see [0] which is a glanceclient release notes
change (and also a failed attempt to apply irrelevant-files in
the glanceclient repo, hence this patch).

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559825/

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-04-09 09:20:05.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo/ovn.yml', 'doc/source/install/tripleo.rst'], 'message': "Simplify the TripleO install guide

This patch is simplifying the TripleO deployment guide by:

* Removing the baremetal instructions since it's not recommended anymore
* Adding a ovn.yml file to generate the correct overcloud-deploy.sh and
  overcloud-prep-containers.sh scripts
* Clarifying some steps about deploying directly on the localhost
* Replace the workaround that was manually creating the
  network-environment.yaml file with a simpler workaround using ansible
  tags (lol, I know right?!)

Note: The tripleo/ovn.yaml could probably live in the tripleo-quickstart

for DevStack). We can always move it later to the tripleo-quickstart
repository if we see the need for it.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie38fcca8ce8334bed6acc827a136656d2c5da3d0

commit_message:
Simplify the TripleO install guide

This patch is simplifying the TripleO deployment guide by:

* Removing the baremetal instructions since it's not recommended anymore
* Adding a ovn.yml file to generate the correct overcloud-deploy.sh and
  overcloud-prep-containers.sh scripts
* Clarifying some steps about deploying directly on the localhost
* Replace the workaround that was manually creating the
  network-environment.yaml file with a simpler workaround using ansible
  tags (lol, I know right?!)

Note: The tripleo/ovn.yaml could probably live in the tripleo-quickstart
repository (under config/general_config). This patch is adding it to the
networking-ovn tree for simplicity (likely we have a .sample config file
for DevStack). We can always move it later to the tripleo-quickstart
repository if we see the need for it.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie38fcca8ce8334bed6acc827a136656d2c5da3d0

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ic00c5d6eeee8858a7bc6bd47a95782374eedb944
Closes-Bug: #1763300

subject: Add entries for #openstack-placement IRC channel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 15:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['accessbot/channels.yaml', 'gerritbot/channels.yaml'], 'message': "Add entries for #openstack-placement IRC channel

An IRC channel for openstack-placement has been created to cut down
on the amount of placement-only traffic in #openstack-nova. This
adds gerritbot and accessbot entries for the new channel, which
has been registed and granted for 'openstackinfra' as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html

A subsequent patch in system-config will add support for meetbot
and statusbot.

Change-Id: Ib5e9f7252343b1ced0ad482c516ce5c17652b64e
"}]
commit_message:
Add entries for #openstack-placement IRC channel

An IRC channel for openstack-placement has been created to cut down
on the amount of placement-only traffic in #openstack-nova. This
adds gerritbot and accessbot entries for the new channel, which
has been registed and granted for 'openstackinfra' as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html

A subsequent patch in system-config will add support for meetbot
and statusbot.

Change-Id: Ib5e9f7252343b1ced0ad482c516ce5c17652b64e

subject: [WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 14:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'config.yaml', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_context.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I913e56c676890c4071f60aa190d02bfaca264d76
(cherry picked from commit 1051fbe10b443801c96a4efaff7acc8697e3fa5d)

commit_message:
Enable missing support for large objects in Swift

The slo and dlo middlewares are required to enable support for large
objects (> 5GB). Also enabling the copy & versioned_writes middleware,
which enables object copying and versionining.

Closes-Bug: 1761412
Change-Id: Iff73833f1d470750862873f70a4a9aaba50bd164
(cherry picked from commit ea55f3de1296407acef8cd1ae5ea2df0e70b4350)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Sahara]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 133d9a2a962c2600632e88bedfbc39e19c48ebf1)
Change-Id: I41088442f29e99c553312d0e4303ea3db6df8dad
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12

commit_message:
Stop persisting previous configuration on update/upgrade prepare

We've been getting a number of errors related to this persistence
(e.g. LP#1758406 or rhbz#1541024). It doesn't seem feasible to
continue to fix them one by one, we should go back to requiring users
pass their -e files to the prepare command.

Related-Bug: #1758406
Change-Id: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8

commit_message:
masquerade: configure FORWARD rules

When enabling masquerading, we need to allow the traffic to go through
so we need the FORWARD rules as well, for source and destination
networks.
Also support multiple destinations or sources for ipv4/ipv6 suffixed
rules with a REGEX.

Change-Id: I48aa95b96c762a72273b5b0b714a04da7ee69a40

Without this patch, the tripleo gate job for networking-ovn was failing

commit_message:
Download TripleO packages from "centos7-queens"

This patch is updating the tripleo-ci/queens.yaml file configuration
file to make it download the TripleO patches from the "centos7-queens"
mirror instead.

Without this patch, the tripleo gate job for networking-ovn was failing
with the message below because it couldn't find the DLRN hash in the
"centos7" mirror (without -queens):

2018-02-23 13:10:40 | Failed to parse dlrn hash
2018-02-23 13:10:40 | + exit 1

Change-Id: I3ea043758f813f33b4e42eae29b12fadd2e66f7c

Enable extras repo when updating containers

repo which are not in base. This is the case of python-crypto
required in ansible update [1]

subject: DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 09:19:01.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/functional/cloud/test_recordset.py', 'openstack/cloud/openstackcloud.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/cloud/test_recordset.py'], 'message': 'DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 16:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Have zuul check out ansible for devel AIO job

Zuul is configured to understand ansible/ansible on github. Add ansible
as a required-project for the devel job so that depends-on patches will
work. Once we're happy with this, we can add the devel-aio job to be run
on PRs to os_ modules.

Change-Id: I12a74d97593c8780047d3dae9590f4e1fde3859b
(cherry picked from commit 148cc97d61b74b73cca8c799250f053c23ec853e)
"}]
commit_message:
Have zuul check out ansible for devel AIO job

Zuul is configured to understand ansible/ansible on github. Add ansible
as a required-project for the devel job so that depends-on patches will
work. Once we're happy with this, we can add the devel-aio job to be run
on PRs to os_ modules.

Change-Id: I12a74d97593c8780047d3dae9590f4e1fde3859b
(cherry picked from commit 148cc97d61b74b73cca8c799250f053c23ec853e)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 new warnings

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer relevant (test_firewall)
were deleted.

Change-Id: Ic784775535547160a0dc0af5d5debfbb1833c6ba

subject: devstack: use neutron-bagpipe-* for service names
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 08:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings.bagpipe_bgp', 'devstack/plugin.sh.bagpipe_bgp', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "devstack: use neutron-bagpipe-* for service names

Using a neutron-something name will enable smart log
display in the CI, which is more than a merely cosmetic
advantage.

Backward compatibility with setups using 'b-bgp' in
local.conf is ensured.

Change-Id: Ie87840816760a8404b341faf45beb99653e27f0e
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: use neutron-bagpipe-* for service names

Using a neutron-something name will enable smart log
display in the CI, which is more than a merely cosmetic
advantage.

Backward compatibility with setups using 'b-bgp' in
local.conf is ensured.

Change-Id: Ie87840816760a8404b341faf45beb99653e27f0e
